jobs.title: Founder's Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
This isn’t your regular job. Almedia is a place where those who want to push harder can accelerate their careers faster than anywhere else. We’re aiming to become Germany’s second bootstrapped unicorn. Almedia is already Europe’s #3 fastest-growing company in 2025 (FT1000).

We are building the future of marketing by rewarding our community of over 50 million users for engaging with our advertisers’ products. We are offering a new way to acquire users for the biggest companies in the world.

At Almedia, you’ll:

  • Own way more, way earlier — you’ll be trusted with responsibility fast.

  • Push harder, get further — this isn’t a 9–5. We highly reward intensity.

  • Join a rare environment — you will work with ambitious high-speed, high-ownership people.

  • Fully present — we’re 5 days a week in the office to build the energising momentum we need.

We are seeking a highly dynamic and versatile Founder's Associate to work directly alongside Almedia's leadership. This isn't a typical project management role; it's for someone exceptionally bright, deeply curious, and hungry for rapid growth, eager to tackle a diverse range of challenges across the business. If you're ready to be highly invested, take extreme ownership, and drive high-impact initiatives from inception in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we want to hear from you.

What You’ll Do 🎯

  • Drive Strategic Initiatives: Spearhead and execute diverse, high-priority projects across various functions (e.g., product, marketing, operations, strategy, finance), directly contributing to Almedia's key growth objectives.

  • Problem Solver & Builder: Dive into complex problems, conduct rapid research and analysis, and develop actionable solutions. You'll not just strategize, but also roll up your sleeves to build and implement.

  • Operational Excellence: Identify inefficiencies and lead efforts to optimize internal processes, tools, and workflows to enhance company-wide productivity and scalability.

  • Cross-Functional Catalyst: Act as a central point of coordination, bridging gaps between different teams and stakeholders to ensure seamless execution and alignment on critical projects.

  • Market & Business Insight: Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and financial modeling to identify new opportunities, evaluate potential ventures, and support strategic decision-making.

  • Ad-Hoc Challenges: Be ready to jump into any mission-critical task that arises, demonstrating flexibility and a proactive approach to unforeseen challenges.

What You’ll Bring 💡

  • Exceptional Intellect & Rapid Learner: Demonstrated ability to quickly grasp new concepts, industries, and complex business models. You pick things up fast and apply knowledge effectively.

  • Proven Impact: A track record of driving tangible results and taking ownership of projects, whether from a startup, consulting, or highly dynamic corporate environment.

  • Analytical Rigor: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of structuring ambiguity, breaking down complex issues, and deriving actionable insights from data.

  • Proactive & Resourceful: High degree of initiative and self-motivation. You identify needs and opportunities without being prompted and figure out how to get things done, even with limited resources.

  • Strong Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, able to articulate complex ideas clearly to diverse audiences, from founders to junior team members.

  • Adaptability & Resilience: Thrives in a fast-paced, ever-changing startup environment with a high tolerance for ambiguity and a growth mindset.

  • Bonus: Experience in a high-growth startup, consulting firm, or venture capital, or a background in [mention specific relevant fields for your company, e.g., SaaS, fintech, mobile gaming].

What Makes You a Great Fit 🌟

  • Owner's Mindset: You treat the company as your own, taking extreme pride and responsibility for every outcome, big or small.

  • Unquenchable Curiosity: You are genuinely fascinated by how businesses grow and operate, always asking "why?" and seeking to understand underlying mechanics.

  • Hunger for Growth: You are driven by a strong desire to learn new skills, tackle bigger challenges, and make a significant impact early in your career.

  • Strategic Doer: You can think high-level strategically but are equally comfortable diving deep into execution details.

  • Entrepreneurial Spirit: You see challenges as opportunities and are excited by the prospect of helping build something impactful from the ground up.

Why Almedia? 🎁

  • Own Our Growth: We offer all Berlin-based employees equity in Almedia to truly be a part of our success.

  • Scale With Almedia: Grow alongside a startup that has been profitable from day one.

  • Central Berlin Office: Work from a fully-stocked modern office built for collaboration, accessible from all around Berlin.

  • Other Benefits: Transport subsidy, breakfasts and lunches, language learning, Urban Sports Club, and more.

  • We Listen: We regularly add to our benefits through rigorous employee feedback.

We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate diversity, and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

What You’ll Do 🎯

  • Own the Channel: Take full, independent ownership of the influencer channel. This includes managing existing agency partnerships while also building new, direct-to-creator collaborations.

  • Drive Strategic Impact: Go beyond surface-level metrics. You will be responsible for analyzing and reporting on campaign performance with a focus on business KPIs like conversion rates, user LTV, and direct revenue contribution.

  • Collaborate & Lead: Work closely with the Head of Growth and other internal teams to align your strategy with broader business goals, serving as the expert voice on all things influencer marketing.

  • 4+ years of hands-on experience in influencer marketing, with a proven track record of managing and scaling a channel.

  • A strong analytical and strategic mindset with the ability to translate data into actionable insights that drive business outcomes, not just campaign vanity metrics.

  • Proven experience with both agencies and direct creator outreach, including strong negotiation and relationship management skills.

  • An entrepreneurial and adaptable spirit that thrives on building processes from scratch in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.

Japan UA Manager
We're looking for a Japan UA Manager to lead our user acquisition efforts in this critical growth markets. You'll develop, execute, and optimize comprehensive UA strategies across diverse platforms, ensuring culturally relevant approaches for Japan.

What You’ll Do

  • Strategic Market Ownership: Develop and own the end-to-end user acquisition strategy for Japan, identifying key growth opportunities and market trends.

  • Multi-Channel Campaign Management: Plan, execute, and meticulously analyze large-scale UA campaigns across relevant local networks, reward platforms, DSPs, Game Media, CTV and other relevant platforms like Google Ads, Unity, Moloco and more.

  • Data-Driven Optimization & Reporting: Lead in-depth data analysis to optimize campaigns based on KPIs, refining targeting and bidding to maximize Roas. Regularly monitor, assess, and present comprehensive reports to stakeholders.

  • Localized Experimentation: Drive continuous A/B testing and optimization of creatives, copy, and targeting, ensuring cultural relevance and maximum performance.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner closely with Creative, Product, Localization, Sales, and Data teams to align UA efforts with company goals and market-specific needs.

  • Partner Management: Manage existing ad partner and agency relationships and identify new platforms and opportunities to enhance performance in Japan.

  • Market Intelligence: Stay updated on the latest UA trends, mobile advertising technologies, and emerging platforms specific to the Japanese market.

What You’ll Bring

  • Extensive UA Experience: 5+ years in mobile user acquisition or performance marketing, with a proven track record of driving results and managing substantial budgets.

  • Regional Expertise: In-depth knowledge of the digital advertising landscape and UA best practices in Japan.

  • Language Proficiency: Fluency in English and Japanese is required.

You will manage the entire early-career recruiting lifecycle, from strategy and university relationship management to selection and offer.

  • University Partnerships: Cultivate and maintain strategic relationships with target universities, academic departments, and student organizations to build diverse, high-potential talent pipelines.

  • Stakeholder Consulting: Partner closely with senior leaders and hiring managers to define early-career needs and consult on program structure, ensuring the quality of hires meets high organizational standards.

  • Campus Presence: Coordinate and execute all campus recruiting events, career fairs, information sessions, and interview days, ensuring a cohesive and exceptional candidate experience.

  • Data-Driven Decisions: Utilize recruitment data (e.g., yield rates, diversity metrics, program feedback) to continuously measure program effectiveness and guide future investment decisions.
